translation: Let’s start with this picture.
transcript: 我们就先从这么一张照片开始。

translation: It is a common housing estate.
transcript: 这是一个非常普通的小区、民宅。

translation: However, it is not common for us.
transcript: 但于我们而言它不普通。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because here is where I started my business.
transcript: 因为这是我创业的发源之地。

translation: In fact, from the start, I didn’t plan to crave out at a housing estate.
transcript: 一开始创业的时候，我压根就没打算去小区。

translation: However, as I asked around, all the industrial parks including Zhangjiang Hi-Tech Park were far more expensive than I could afford.
transcript: 但是到处打听下来，所有的园区啊，包括那个张江园区贵得一踏糊涂。

translation: Hence I had no alternative but to give up the first preference.
transcript: 没办法退而求其次。

translation: In that way, as college student entrepreneurs, we had to start the business in a humble residential district.
transcript: 我们这种大学生创业者哦，只有蜗居到小区里头，开始我自己的创业之路。

translation: But we adapted to such an environment soon.
transcript: 不过也很快，我们就适应了这种创业的这种这种小区里创业的感觉。

translation: Please look at this photo.
transcript: 不信你们看哈，这个像。

translation: We lived and ate together, and regarded company as our home.
transcript: 我们吃住在一块儿，以公司为家。

translation: Joy was overflowing at that time.
transcript: 这平时可以非常快乐地创业。

translation: We were dedicated to our career and discussed with great ambition.
transcript: 啊，非常专注，然后可以不知天高地厚地讨论问题。

translation: In the winter, we can appreciate the snow-covered views, or have a snowball fight.
transcript: 你看，这大冬天的我们还可以玩雪景啊，可以打雪仗，很开心。

translation: Just as in this photo, we were happy and amicable like a real family.
transcript: 就像这一张照片上，和睦得像一家人一样其乐融融。

translation: So in the beginning, it was good.
transcript: 所以一开始蛮好的。

translation: We started with eight members.
transcript: 我们这个八个人起家嘛。

translation: Actually, it was great.
transcript: 非常好。

translation: However, as we gradually developed into a group of more than 20 people, troubles followed close on.
transcript: 但是逐渐地发展到了二十来号人，麻烦来了。

translation: As we sometimes occupied the elevator, discontent spread among several neighbors.
transcript: 因为有些时候偶尔会占用一下这个电梯资源嘛，惹得一部分居民不高兴。

translation: What’s worse, they insisted on complaining and even reporting to the administration for industry and commerce.
transcript: 不高兴就算了，非去投诉我们，还去举报。

translation: That was not the worst.
transcript: 你举报就举报嘛，你干嘛要不说真话。

translation: They also fabricated the rumor that, “Something happened in our community! A very serious problem! Hundreds of people engaged in illegal training here!”
transcript: 他跟工商讲说：“我们小区出事儿了，出大事儿，几百号人，在我们小区里头搞非法培训！”

translation: Oh my goodness!
transcript: 哇！

translation: Owing to this, officials in the department were highly eager to get into action since they hadn’t met such a major case.
transcript: 弄的所里头的同事们是摩拳擦掌、跃跃欲试，从来没有见过这么大的case诶。

translation: One day, the head of the department personally led a crowd of officials and rushed to our office.
transcript: 有一天，所长亲自带队，一大帮子人就冲到了我们的办公室里头来啊。

translation: At that time, I still had a meeting with my customer elsewhere.
transcript: 当时我还在外面见客户。

translation: Afterwards, I heard from my colleagues that a group of people stormed in, who were all dressed in uniform and amounted to a dozen or so.
transcript: 后来我听我同事讲，那一伙人气势汹汹地冲进来，都穿制服的，足有十来号。

translation: It is surprising that they came in without a single word, just looked around and took photos, and finally left quietly.
transcript: 结果这帮人进来之后我是一言不发，还转了好几圈好几圈，还拍了些照片儿，走的时候还静悄悄得。

translation: A huge puzzle for us.
transcript: 很纳闷，没搞明白是怎么回事儿。

translation: After that, the department frequently contacted me, asking me to have a face-to-face talk with the head in the office.
transcript: 后来这所里头就一直联系我，说要约我，到所里面谈，而且还要跟所长单独谈。

translation: The head asked me, “Young man, what’s your opinion on solving this?”
transcript: 那所长就问我，他说：“小伙子咂，这事儿怎么解决啊？”

translation: After pondering, since I had prepares for the worst, I replied that you could act accordingly.
transcript: 我琢磨着怎么解决啊，要钱没有要命一条，看着办呗，啊！

translation: Surprisingly, he said: “Well, if I am not wrong, as I entered into your office, the first impression was that it was similar to America’s Apple and Google who rose from garages. Listen to me, young minds think alike, I am on your side.”
transcript: 结果没想到他说：“我跟你讲哦，如果我没猜错的话，我进你的办公室，第一感是这就是美国的苹果、Google一开始在车库里头创业的感觉，我告诉你，我也是年轻人我懂的。”

translation: Dramatically, right?
transcript: 噢呀，180度大转弯？

translation: The thrill was beyond description and I asked: “ Do you mean no punishment then?”
transcript: 我那个激动啊，我说：“所长那你的意思就是不罚啦？”

translation: He completely ignored my question and continued, “Believe me, I have seen many enterprises, but few can be on a par with yours. The community will restrict your development and there must be many industrial parks which are eager to let you in. If you rent a new place and get ready to move, let me know and then it’s settled, OK?”
transcript: 他完全无视我，他继续说：“我给你讲哦，你要相信我，我见过企业多了，像你这样的不多见的，你这种企业再呆在小区里头你是浪费生命，赶紧出去，不知道多少家园区要抢着要你，等你把房子租好啦，自己要搬走啦，给我打声招呼，咱这事儿把它了了好不好？”

translation: Thanks to unexpected good fortune that got me out of the trouble.
transcript: 出门遇贵人啊，就这么着化险为夷了一次。

translation: I remember that the head was thirty-seven or -eight years old at that time, and I was about ten years younger.
transcript: 嗯，我印象中当时这所长三十七八岁，那时候我二十七八岁。

translation: In fact, during the entrepreneurial process, such problems were quite common.
transcript: 其实在这一路的创业的过程中，像这样乱七八糟的事儿啊多了去了。

translation: Today, I will not go into details for lack of time.
transcript: 今天时间有限我就不展开一一细讲了。

translation: Another story.
transcript: 我就记得有那么一次。

translation: Once, salary day coincided with the blank account.
transcript: 要发工资了，碰巧账上已经没有钱了。

translation: No money left at all.
transcript: 没有钱了。

translation: I stopped an employee and asked him , “Do you have 1,800 yuan?”
transcript: 我叫住一个员工跟他讲，我说：“你有没有一千八百块钱？”

translation: He happened to have the money and gave it to me.
transcript: 他碰巧有给我了。

translation: However, I said, “Please wait.”
transcript: 我说：“你别走。”

translation: “Anything else?” he asked.
transcript: “干嘛？”

translation: “This is your salary this month.” I said.
transcript: “这是你这个月的工资。”

translation: He was surprised but I was not.
transcript: 他很惊讶，我不惊讶。

translation: Although I knew that later payment of salary would not disappoint the staff, at the very beginning, I swore to myself that arrears of wages was never in my dictionary.
transcript: 不过我知道即使是我迟一点发工资，大家一定不会有意见，但问题是我创业之初，就自己暗下誓言绝对不可以拖欠薪水。

translation: I myself could owe you money, but our company must not do in the same way.
transcript: 我个人可以欠你钱，但是公司绝对不可以拖欠薪水。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢大家。

translation: I remember it was my most difficult and embarrassing time in terms of money.
transcript: 印象中那是我，在钱方面最困难最窘的一次。

translation: Same things never happened since then.
transcript: 之后再也没有那么难过。

translation: However, despite great hardness, no one gave up.
transcript: 但是再难再苦，没有任何人放弃我们的事业。

translation: Instead, we were still a cheerful team and moved forwards to our dream, Internet education.
transcript: 大家依旧乐呵呵地聚在一块，朝着当时我们的互联网教育的方向在耕耘。

translation: Maybe a question is haunting in your minds.
transcript: 可能各位听众，你们不禁要问了。

translation: At that time, you gathered those people and let them contributed their bits to a seemingly abstruse and insubstantial goal, what had you done to deserve this?
transcript: 说你阿诺何德何能在那个时候，可以把一伙人聚在一块朝着一个那时候看起来还是如此的虚无缥缈的目标去奋斗？

translation: To be frank, at the beginning of my entrepreneurship, I was an ordinary college graduate, the most ordinary one.
transcript: 老实讲在我创业之初，就是一个最普通、最平凡的大学生。

translation: Here, this picture shows in 2005, how I, a post-graduate who just left college and decided to start a business, looked like.
transcript: 你们可以看这张照片，这是2005年我研究生刚毕业那一会儿，决定要创业之前的一个状态。

translation: A “hairy” young man indeed.
transcript: 就是一个毛头小伙子。

translation: Not “hairy” enough?
transcript: 如果你觉得还不够毛的话？

translation: Then turn to this one.
transcript: 你看这一张。

translation: Thick hair, right?
transcript: 那个怒发冲冠哦，这个头发很茂密啊？

translation: But look at me now, time has “polished” my top.
transcript: 不像现在啊，这里这么多年创业下来都磨平了。

translation: It’s a natural thing since I always went to bed at 3 or 4 o’clock in the morning after 14 hours of work time every day.
transcript: 没办法，创业嘛，每天晚上3、4点钟睡觉是很正常的事情，工作一天十四个小时是家常便饭。

translation: Work was a routine no matter others relaxed or not.
transcript: 你休息我工作你休息我还工作。

translation: Starting a business deprived me of a normal life.
transcript: 创业其实不是人受的日子。

translation: Looking back, I don’t want to start a business anymore.
transcript: 回过头来就不想再去创业了。

translation: True words sometimes.
transcript: 有些时候是真的是这个样子。

translation: At that time, thick hair was not my only “advantage”, but more importantly, I was full of vigour and enthusiasm.
transcript: 但是呢那个时候啊，我不是光是头发茂密，更关键的是精力旺盛。

translation: I was fond of the Internet and firmly believed that it was the key to change everything, including future education in China.
transcript: 啊，就是喜欢互联网，坚持认为互联网可以改变一切，包括未来中国的教育。

translation: To this end, I started Hujiang, an online learning platform at a very early time.
transcript: 所以我很早就办了这个沪江网。

translation: To be more specific, since my junior year in college in 2001, Hujiang was founded and open to the public free of charge afterwards.
transcript: 大学三年级2001年的时候，我就把这个网站办出来，之后一直是免费公益的状态在运营着。

translation: Hence when I graduated and embarked on real career, I was not alone due to my partners.
transcript: 等我研究生毕业那会儿，不得不走上创业之路的时候，我就不孤单，我是有伴的。

translation: He is my first partner, the CTO of Hujiang.
transcript: 这位是我创业路上的第一位兄弟，沪江网的CTO。

translation: I chose him as his skills were, well, a little better than mine.
transcript: 当时选他哦，那他的技术实在是，就比我牛一点点。

translation: He graduated from Sun Yat-sen University in Guangdong province, majoring in Geophysics plus Accounting, which had nothing to do with the Internet technology.
transcript: 你看他的专业，广东中山大学，地球物理外加会计双专业，跟互联网技术一点边都不沾。

translation: However, one year before graduation, he adopted asp technology to conduct a subject.
transcript: 但这个家伙啊在毕业的那一年，用asp技术哦他做了一个课题。

translation: After that, his interest got out of hand, so did his belief in his own future success in this field.
transcript: 之后就一发不可收拾，他坚持认为自己将来在这个领域会大有作为。

translation: Later he did a part-time job in Shanghai, and met me.
transcript: 后来来到上海兼职打工的时候跟我认识。

translation: We fit in easily.
transcript: 然后一拍即合。

translation: It reminds of an anecdote.
transcript: 那时候有个笑话。

translation: At that time, we all called him “general engineer”.
transcript: 我们都叫他“总程总程”。

translation: Others would associate it with “chief engineer”.
transcript: 一到外面别人一听说，“奥！这是你们的总工程师吧。”

translation: In fact, the true meaning was shared simply among our team members.
transcript: 其实我们知道。

translation: As we had a difficult start and for a long time, he was generally the only one programming engineer, or abbreviated as “general engineer”.
transcript: 因为创业之初嘛困难，很长一段时间总是只有他这么一个程序员，嘿嘿，简称“总程”。

translation: Now here is another picture.
transcript: 我们再看这个哈。

translation: It was the first gathering before starting our business, in which I invited all the people who helped me free of charge during those five years.
transcript: 这是创业前的我们一次聚首，我把五年当中一直免费这公益的帮助过我的兄弟姐妹们就叫了一块儿。

translation: I said, “I’ve decided to start a formal company and now we can own the shares together. But all of you should first finish a task, that is, to borrow money separately!”
transcript: 我说：“我决定要成立公司，正儿八经干了哦。我做一个决定，把新公司的股份分给你们，你们所有的人，要完成新公司的第一个任务，干嘛？回家去分头借钱！”

translation: I had same task as well.
transcript: 我也回家去了。

translation: However, though I borrowed from all acquaintances, more money was necessary.
transcript: 我回到家把我们家的钱全都借完了，还不够。

translation: Then back to Shanghai, I turned to an intimate classmate during college and asked him to borrow me 20,000 yuan.
transcript: 又返回上海，找到了大学的一个同学一个哥们儿，我就跟他讲，我说：“你有没有2万块钱？”

translation: He looked at me and answered, “No.”
transcript: 他看着我说：“没有。”

translation: I was downhearted accordingly.
transcript: 心里头拔凉拔凉。

translation: Actually I had made full mental preparations in case of failure to borrow more money.
transcript: 尽管我来之前做了十足的心理准备，估计是借不着钱。

translation: Naturally, a new graduate from college may barely earn his living, let alone to save 20,000 yuan that was available to support your new business with an ambiguous future .
transcript: 因为大家想想看嘛，刚毕业的大学生，养活自己也不容易，还得为你攒出2万块钱，去干创业那时候那么不靠谱的事儿。

translation: Though I didn’t hold much hope, I was then overcome by sorrow.
transcript: 所以其实我是有这个这个心理准备的，但是心里还是止不住难过。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: Because I had no methods towards more money, neither vc nor angel investors.
transcript: 因为我没有其他的来钱的办法，我也不认识什么vc，也不知道什么天使。

translation: In other words, angel investors didn’t know me either.
transcript: 天使也不认识我对吧。

translation: Fortunately, as I was at a loss what to do and depressed at losing the last straw, he looked straight at me, and added several words: “But my father has money!”
transcript: 这个所以，正在我一筹莫展的时候，为这最后一根稻草失去而难过的时候，这兄弟又两眼睛直勾勾地看着我他说：“但是我爸有！”

translation: I didn’t even know how he managed to persuade his father.
transcript: 我最后都不知道他是怎么从他老爸手里头把两万块钱给kiang出来。

translation: The funny thing afterwards was that he held the money tight and I wanted to take it, so the money moved back and forth between us for several times.
transcript: 然后给我的时候啊我们拽来拽去，拽来拽去。

translation: I said, “What are you doing? Do you regret?”
transcript: 我说：“你啥意思？你后悔不给我了？”

translation: He replied, “No, no, no. The last question, OK? Can we give up now?”
transcript: 他说：“不不不不不，我再最后问你一个问题，”什么问题呢？“咱能不能不创业？ ”

translation: “Ridiculous! If I quit now, why do I borrow your money?”
transcript: “去！不创业我问你借钱干嘛？”

translation: He explained, “OK, listen to me. You, Fu Cairui, is not the last among classmates. Why not choose other careers? Is starting a business a must? How can you make profit?”
transcript: 他说：“你看哦，付彩瑞你这个人在同学里头你是不痴不笨不呆不傻，你干什么不行？干嘛非得去创业？我问你啊，你怎么赚钱？”

translation: Then I said, “Mm... I don’t know.”
transcript: 我说：“我不知道。”

translation: At that time, I didn't think too much of it as I had already made up my mind to start a business.
transcript: 当时也容不得我去想，我一定要走上创业这条道儿。

translation: Unexpectedly, I finally got the money.
transcript: 就这么着这钱他竟然给我借过来了。

translation: Therefore, we can conclude that we surely need partners and friends, especially when you are in trouble, or just start a business.
transcript: 所以人有时候真的是特别需要伴儿需要朋友，尤其是在你困难的时候，在你创业的时候。

translation: Owing to the money, at last, 8 members were equipped with 8 swivel chairs and in the aforementioned housing estate, started with 80,000 yuan.
transcript: 有了这些钱啊，我们终于可以八个人八张转椅，在刚刚那个小区里头靠着这8万块钱就正式起家了。

translation: Then how about others apart from the original 8 members?
transcript: 这里头超过八个的人头都是谁呢？

translation: They were all boyfriends or girlfriends of these 8 ones, or their relatives.
transcript: 都是其他八个人的额男女朋友，或者是亲人亲属。

translation: There’s a saying goes, “If one person starts a business, the whole family will suffer”.
transcript: 有句话这么讲嘛，叫“一人创业，全家受罪”。

translation: Look！
transcript: 你看！

translation: Luckily, we did better in the second year.
transcript: 还好我们第二年就这个样子了。

translation: Following photos were taken in the second, the third, the fourth, the fifth, the sixth, finally the six and a half years, now.
transcript: 第二年，这个第三年对吧，啊第四年、第五年、第六年、六年半、now现在。

translation: For a long time since our start, if I am to sum up, the greatest experience is that, if you want to go fast, go on your own.
transcript: 创业这么长时间以来，如果你让我去总结的话，我最大的感受是：如果你要想走得快，一个人上路。

translation: Because nobody will disagree with you and you can just follow your own heart.
transcript: 因为没有人管你，爱咋地咋地。

translation: But if you want to go far, go along with partners.
transcript: 但如果你要想走得远，结伴而行。

translation: Furthermore, if you want to go far and steady, multiply your partners.
transcript: 如果你要想走得又远又扎实，成群结队。

translation: Sometimes I would like to compare starting a new business with the journey to the west.
transcript: 所以有些时候我总是感觉，创业就像是西天取经。

translation: Tang Monk had never imagined to go along with a monkey(Sun Wukong) and a pig(Zhu Bajie), nor all sorts of monsters and astonishing experience.
transcript: 唐僧在一开始压根就不知道，他会跟猴子、猪为伴，他也不知道他会碰到多少乱七八糟的妖怪和多少意想不到的事儿。

translation: But the process is still so fascinating and exciting that it makes you feel like you can change the world, or you have changed the world to what extent.
transcript: 但是创业这个过程，还是那么令人着迷，很兴奋，让你感觉到你可以改变全世界，或者你把全世界给改变到了什么样的程度。

translation: In conclusion, if entrepreneurship is a journey, destination is naturally important, but it is more crucial to set out with those like-minded.
transcript: 所以要我说，如果创业就是一趟旅程的话，终点固然重要，但是能够和自己志同道合的同伴们一块启程，更重要。

translation: If we compare the career we pursue to a vast ocean, then the most crucial part is to set sail with those who share similar ideas.
transcript: 如果我们想要去追寻的事业，就像是一片广袤无垠的大海的话，那么和自己志同道合的水手们扬帆起航，最重要。

translation: To conclude, not only to myself, but also “TnDao” and all the members, wish you all the best in 2013, and go further.
transcript: 最后不光是冲着我自个儿哈，也祝我们“听道”和联合会的各位兄弟姐妹好朋友们，2013年都越来越好，都能够飞得更高。
